intro: Horkelia fusca var. tenuiloba, commonly known as the slender horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, pale blue to purple flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Horkelia fusca var. tenuiloba is often found in open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and grasslands.
